alert.note: Alert for Ballard; Carlisle; Fulton; Hickman (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:23AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Alexander, western Fulton, Carlisle, northern Hickman, southern Ballard, Mississippi, southeastern Scott, northeastern New Madrid and southeastern Stoddard Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 823 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cairo to near Miner to near Morehouse. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wickliffe, Wyatt and Anniston around 835 AM CDT. East Prairie around 840 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Farrenburg, Matthews, Bardwell, New Madrid, Lilbourn, Big Oak Tree State Park, Hunter-Dawson State Historic Site, Towosahgy State Historic Site, Howardville and Dorena. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 4. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 1 and 21. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 40 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
